<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// A RISC-V hart has a single byte-addressable address space of 2^XLEN bytes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for all memory accesses, so it is reasonable to assume that an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// implementation has no-op address space casts. If an implementation makes a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// change to this, they can override it here.</span></CodeLine>
